adjective.description: Split, divided, or partially divided into two.

noun.description: A fissure or split, especially one in rock or the ground.
examples: the third peak is divided from the eastern one by a deep cleft

origin: Middle English clift: of Germanic origin; related to Dutch kluft and German Kluft, also to cleave. The form of the word was altered in the 16th century by association with cleft.
